answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Your symptoms could be due to neuropathy which could be a side effect of the medications you are taking. Diabetes causes peripheral neuropathy, damage to the leg nerves. Alcoholism and vitamin deficiencies can also cause neuropathy. Sometimes allergy to the inner lining of shoes can cause burning. All these are suggestions and you will need to consult your primary care physician in person for proper evaluation of your diabetes status. He may ask for a Nerve Conduction studies to evaluate the nerves. Hope this helped!

question: I am having the strangest problem.  It feels like my middle toe on my left foot is resting on its neighbor toe, but when I look down, it is perfectly seperated from the other toes.  has anyone ever had this?  I am posting in neuro because i have numerous other neuro symptoms and am wondering is this is part of tht larger picture.    I have also had a strange feeling in my big toe on my right foot for months. it feels numb, but i can stll feel sensation.background: 29 weeks pregnant, third child, overweight, chronic hypertension, on Labetalol bid 100 mg, neuro symptoms for 8 months
title: toe feels like in a strange position but is not
